intro: Ateleia arsenii, commonly known as the Armenian acanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and showy, violet-blue bracts. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. It is known for its ornamental value and has been cultivated in botanical gardens for its unique appearance. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered in the wild.
